body:
Hi
 I am trying to get the password of whatsapp in IOS by MissVenom. I do this work by the guide https://github.com/shirioko/MissVenom, but it prompt  the password entry of certificate when installing.I do not know the password.

And i install the certificate by the link (https://github.com/shirioko/MissVenom/blob/master/MissVenom/all.whatsapp.net.pfx?raw=true) which from the  issues 365(https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/365).

comment_data.body:
Why don't you visit https://cert.whatsapp.net from your phone as described in MissVenom?

You can find the password for the pfx file in MissVenom's source code in Form1.cs

This issue is also posted in the wrong project btw
I can not  access the link https://cert.whatsapp.net after starting  MissVenom.exe,so i choose another way.
Did you change your DNS address on your phone?

When i change the DNS address of the static IP ,it seem that it does  not work,the address  will be reset as blank space.

So i change the DNS address of DHCP directly for this ,and i can not access the link.

Then you don't know how to use your own device. This has been tested on Android, iOS and Windows Phone 7.8.
Which mobile OS are you using?
IOS

Set your IP settings to DHCP and write down the IP address, subnet mask and default gateway that you get.
Then change your IP settings to static and enter this:
- IP address: IP address you received when using DHCP (e.g. 192.168.0.103)
- Subnet mask: subnet mask you received when using DHCP (e.g. 255.255.255.0)
- Default gateway: gateway address you received when using DHCP (e.g. 192.168.0.1 or 192.168.0.254)
- DNS: the IP address displayed in MissVenom

This should do the trick

Thank you!
It  still does not work.The process is very slow and prompt "could not open the page".
And the DNS address of DHCP will become same as that of static.
I attach 2 pictures.
![static](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4647079/773832/307d8286-e944-11e2-92c9-ae27c112eca6.jpg)
![dhcp](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4647079/773835/35ad6a96-e944-11e2-8e3d-da8d0e37bf9c.jpg)

The IP address got by MissVenom is 10.249.244.182,and i can access other websites.

And what output does Missvenom generate?

@jonnywilliamson you used this on your iPhone, did you encounter this as well?

Started DNS proxy...
SSL proxy started
Listening...
 
Set your DNS address on your phone to 10.249.244.182 (Settings->WiFi->Static IP->DNS) and go to https://cert.whatsapp.net in your phone's browser to install the root certificate

I think there is something wrong in accessing the DNS proxy,so it does not work.

Can you install
https://itunes.apple.com/nl/app/inettools-network-diagnose/id561659975?mt=8
and see to which IP address cert.whatsapp.net resolves by using ping? Make sure you use static IP and set your DNS address to MissVenom's address.

If I clear away the DNS IP,it prompt "invalid host name or IP address."  when using ping.
If i add the DNS IP,it access 10.249.244.182.It can access the DNS proxy successfully.

It could be something as stupid as Safari rejecting MissVenom's SSL certificate. Can you install this on your iPhone:
https://github.com/shirioko/MissVenom/blob/master/MissVenom/server.v2.crt?raw=true
and then try going to 
```
https://v.whatsapp.net/v2/exist
```
This should show some output in Missvenom

I have done this work at our company before.
I did this work at home right now,a different network,I could send message suesfully.
Thank u very much.
I will continue to do this to resovle the problem at company tommrow .
Ok,I can access the link( https://cert.whatsapp.net )successfully today.

I want to sniff the TCP data by the guide(https://github.com/shirioko/MissVenom)

*Launch MissVenom.exe
*Enter the device password, click the checkbox on the left and press Start

For the step 2,i am not clear about how to do the operation,because there are not the corresponding input&check box in the MissVenom.

It didn't work reliably so I removed it in 1.2.4.0
You can try an older version of you want.

I get some encoded logs(e.g."gABWX5VzikFJ/iUEghhevGxviJhoIVrQTRRr/xA2eWxwnecrkDjiWfKTP1xGzi8UiTItCV2m6MpzS6KLYXmYfTCpHhtQ2MQLTBfzr3nOVxgtmaMLPBP80kU=").
It can be decoded by BASE64,but the result is not readable.Is the  data package encrypted?
But this is no longer WhatsAPI related. If you have more questions you can inbox me or start an issue on my MissVenom repository :)
hi i can't  open  https://cert.whatsapp.net
no ping to  https://cert.whatsapp.net
hey,im trying to use missvenom but its sends a "socket error"..(im using windows,nexsus 4 android 4.4.4 kitkat),can you plese help me?

title: The password of certificate when using MissVenom
